medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The infant presented to the ED 7 hours after being discharged from the NICU. She had been breastfeeding but failed to latch, leading to a switch to a combination of expressed breast milk and standard infant formula. She consistently took 2 oz every 2 hours, spitting up approximately 1 oz each time. Before ED arrival, she took 2 oz and emesis occurred of the entire feeding, which was non-bloody and non-bilious.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Spent 3 days in the NICU due to hypoglycemia.
medical_history.family_history: Mother has a history of hypertension; no other relevant family medical history specified.
